snippet: Ending the discount for multiple rides would help lower the expected increase in basic fares, said the authority’s chairman, Joseph J. Lhota.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority is considering eliminating or reducing 7 percent discount currently offered to riders who buy pay-per-ride MetroCards of at least $10; eliminating the discount would not raise all of the $450 million a year in revenue the authority is expecting to generate from a looming fare increase, but would likely lower the amount by which the base fare of $2.25 or the rate for an unlimited card will rise.
lead_paragraph: Ending the discount for multiple rides would help lower the expected increase in basic fares, said the authority’s chairman, Joseph J. Lhota.

headline.seo: M.T.A. May Eliminate 7% Bonuses on MetroCards
headline.main: MetroCards May Lose 7% Bonuses by Next Year
headline.print_headline: MetroCards May Lose 7% Bonuses By Next Year
